page.title: 20CONCLUSION
page.content: The area is one of sharp contrasts. Military activity at St Mawgan has given rise to the establishment of a Peace Chapel near Trebarber farm and Bank holiday protests by C.N.D. groups lead to an influx of tents and police reinforcements. Porth reservoir supplies the massive summer population and has not failed in recent droughts and affords pleasure to anglers and yachtsmen. The large Chapel dairy farm provides other liquid sustenance. The railway branch line has often been threatened since the days of the Beeching axe but provides a skeleton service in winter and is still heavily used in the holiday season -hence its survival. Quintrell Downs which has recently seen substantial residential development doggedly retains its individuality.
